A Psalm of David. LORD, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.
Let my prayer be set forth before thee <FI>as<Fi> incense; <FI>and<Fi> the lifting up of my hands <FI>as<Fi> the evening sacrifice.<RF>set…: Heb. directed<Rf>
Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.
Incline not my heart to <FI>any<Fi> evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.<CM>

Let the righteous smite me; <FI>it shall be<Fi> a kindness: and let him reprove me; <FI>it shall be<Fi> an excellent oil, <FI>which<Fi> shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also <FI>shall be<Fi> in their calamities.<RF>me; it shall be a…: or, let the rigteous smite mee kindly, and reprove me; let not their precious oil break my head, etc<Rf>
When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.
Our bones are scattered at the grave's mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth <FI>wood<Fi> upon the earth.
But mine eyes <FI>are<Fi> unto thee, O GOD the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.<RF>leave…: Heb. make not my soul bare<Rf>
Keep me from the snares <FI>which<Fi> they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.
Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.<RF>escape: Heb. pass over<Rf><CM>
